title: Asymmetric Mobility Intro
text: initial values geographic locations. list containing 1 mobility matrix per time period (4 time periods per day, 5 days = 20 time periods). mobility matrix must contain non-diagonal links (.e. every geographical location combination must included, except people “staying home”) One beta per time period.
code: spread::asymmetric_mobility_dummy_seiiar_pop #>    location_code    S E  I Ia R #> 1:             a 1000 0 50  0 0 #> 2:             b 1000 0  0  0 0 #> 3:             c 2000 0  0  0 0 length(spread::asymmetric_mobility_dummy_mobility_matrix) #> [1] 20 spread::asymmetric_mobility_dummy_mobility_matrix[[1]] #>    from to  n #> 1:    a  b 50 #> 2:    a  c 10 #> 3:    b  a 10 #> 4:    b  c 10 #> 5:    c  a 10 #> 6:    c  b 10 spread::asymmetric_mobility_dummy_betas #>  [1] 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 0.6 #> [20] 0.6

title: Asymmetric Mobility Intro
text: b_* variables represent status people belonging particular geographical location. c_* variables represent current status people existing geographical location time point.

title: Simple Branching Process Model
text: show use branching process model modelling potential spread SARS-like corona virus. branching process model takes information basic reproduction number, serial interval dispersion parameter can make short term forecasts number new cases. current model take account depletion suceptibles introduction control measures. Following Lipsitch et Al 2003 use value R0 3 serial interval mean 8.4 days SD 3.4 days. also set dispersion parameter 0.16 following Lloyd-Smith et Al 2005.    median number cases around 50, probability spread around 6%.
code: library(ggplot2) library(epitrix)  #Defining the serial interval  mu <- 8.4 sd <- 3.4 param <- epitrix::gamma_mucv2shapescale(mu, sd/mu) si <-   distcrete::distcrete("gamma", interval = 1,                 shape = param$shape,                 scale = param$scale, w = 0)   incidences <- spread::branching_process(initial_cases=1,                                          R0=1.4,                          dispersion=1,                          serial_interval=si,                          days_simulation=30,                          simulations=1000) summary <- spread::summarize_bp(incidences) spread::plot_quantiles_bp(incidences) + ggtitle("Estimated daily incidence") + xlab("Days") + ylab("Incidence") spread::plot_quantiles_bp(summary$cumulative) + ggtitle("Estimated cumulative case counts")  + xlab("Days") + ylab("cumulative Cases") ggplot() + geom_histogram(aes(x=colSums(incidences))) +theme_minimal() +ggtitle("Distribution of number of cases after 30 days") + xlab("N cases after 30 days") print(median(summary$cumulative[30,])) #> [1] 5 print(summary$p_no_spread) #> [1] 0.242

what: Estimating parameters via approximate Bayesian computation (ABC)
title: Simple Branching Process Model
text: can also estimate R0 know number cases time t. assume 2000 4000 cases 56 days. One can also vary parameters include uncertainty
code: mu <- 8.4 sd <- 3.4 param <- epitrix::gamma_mucv2shapescale(mu, sd/mu) si <-   distcrete::distcrete("gamma", interval = 1,                 shape = param$shape,                 scale = param$scale, w = 0) params <- list() for(R0 in seq(from=1, to=10, by=0.05)){     params[[length(params)+1]] <- list(       initial_cases=1,                       R0=R0,       dispersion=1,       serial_interval=si,       days_simulation=56     ) }  r <- spread::fit_params_bp(   cases_min = 2000,   cases_max = 3000,    param_list = params,    simulations=1000   ) #> Warning: UNRELIABLE VALUE: One of the 'future.apply' iterations #> ('future_lapply-1') unexpectedly generated random numbers without declaring so. #> There is a risk that those random numbers are not statistically sound and the #> overall results might be invalid. To fix this, specify 'future.seed=TRUE'. This #> ensures that proper, parallel-safe random numbers are produced via the L'Ecuyer- #> CMRG method. To disable this check, use 'future.seed = NULL', or set option #> 'future.rng.onMisuse' to "ignore". print(HDInterval::hdi(r$R0)) #> lower upper  #>  2.05  4.40  #> attr(,"credMass") #> [1] 0.95

title: Commuter Model Intro
text: model stochastic SEIIaR (susceptible, exposed, infectious, infectious asymptomatic, recovered) metapopulation model. location local infection system, locations connected people commute day. model differentiates day night. day can infect/infected location work, night can infect/infected location live. commuters travel back forth day. start day, commuters sent work location, mix 12 hours. commuters sent respective home locations, mix 12 hours. model loosely based upon published model Engebretsen (2019).

title: Commuter Model Intro
text: seiiar dataset contains following variables entire population want model: location_code code location S starting value susceptible people E starting value exposed people starting value infectious symptomatic people Ia starting value infectious asymptomatic people R starting value recovered people commuters dataset contains following variables: location code location people live location code location people work n number people applies r0 basic reproductive number. latent_period average number days person exposed infectious. asymptomatic_prob probability infectious person asymptomatic. asymptomatic_relative_infectiousness relative infectiousness asymptomatic infectious person compared symptomatic infectious person. value 0 1. days_simulation number days want simulate. N number simulations run results averaged. generally set 1, unless performing model fitting.
code: library(ggplot2) library(data.table) # no one in Norway is infected, and everyone is susceptible spread::nor_seiiar_noinfected_2017_b2020 #>        location_code      S E I Ia R #>   1: municip_nor0301 666759 0 0  0 0 #>   2: municip_nor1101  14899 0 0  0 0 #>   3: municip_nor1103 140856 0 0  0 0 #>   4: municip_nor1106  37166 0 0  0 0 #>   5: municip_nor1108  76742 0 0  0 0 #>  ---                                 #> 352: municip_nor5440    991 0 0  0 0 #> 353: municip_nor5441   2911 0 0  0 0 #> 354: municip_nor5442    951 0 0  0 0 #> 355: municip_nor5443   2267 0 0  0 0 #> 356: municip_nor5444  10199 0 0  0 0  # 10 people in Oslo are infected, and everyone is susceptible spread::nor_seiiar_oslo_2017_b2020 #>        location_code      S E  I Ia R #>   1: municip_nor0301 666749 0 10  0 0 #>   2: municip_nor1101  14899 0  0  0 0 #>   3: municip_nor1103 140856 0  0  0 0 #>   4: municip_nor1106  37166 0  0  0 0 #>   5: municip_nor1108  76742 0  0  0 0 #>  ---                                  #> 352: municip_nor5440    991 0  0  0 0 #> 353: municip_nor5441   2911 0  0  0 0 #> 354: municip_nor5442    951 0  0  0 0 #> 355: municip_nor5443   2267 0  0  0 0 #> 356: municip_nor5444  10199 0  0  0 0  # no one in Norway is infected, and childhood vaccination data is used to # estimate the number of "recovered" (i.e. non-susceptible) people for measles spread::nor_seiiar_measles_noinfected_2017_b2020 #>        location_code     S E I Ia      R #>   1: municip_nor0301 59775 0 0  0 606984 #>   2: municip_nor1101  1027 0 0  0  13872 #>   3: municip_nor1103  8868 0 0  0 131988 #>   4: municip_nor1106  1557 0 0  0  35609 #>   5: municip_nor1108  3058 0 0  0  73684 #>  ---                                     #> 352: municip_nor5440    56 0 0  0    935 #> 353: municip_nor5441   513 0 0  0   2398 #> 354: municip_nor5442    72 0 0  0    879 #> 355: municip_nor5443   150 0 0  0   2117 #> 356: municip_nor5444  1149 0 0  0   9050  # 10 people in Oslo is infected, and childhood vaccination data is used to # estimate the number of "recovered" (i.e. non-susceptible) people for measles spread::nor_seiiar_measles_oslo_2017_b2020 #>        location_code     S E  I Ia      R #>   1: municip_nor0301 59765 0 10  0 606984 #>   2: municip_nor1101  1027 0  0  0  13872 #>   3: municip_nor1103  8868 0  0  0 131988 #>   4: municip_nor1106  1557 0  0  0  35609 #>   5: municip_nor1108  3058 0  0  0  73684 #>  ---                                      #> 352: municip_nor5440    56 0  0  0    935 #> 353: municip_nor5441   513 0  0  0   2398 #> 354: municip_nor5442    72 0  0  0    879 #> 355: municip_nor5443   150 0  0  0   2117 #> 356: municip_nor5444  1149 0  0  0   9050  # we can take a closer look at Oslo spread::nor_seiiar_measles_oslo_2017_b2020[location_code=="municip_nor0301"] #>      location_code     S E  I Ia      R #> 1: municip_nor0301 59765 0 10  0 606984 # we provide the number of municipal commuters in Norway in 2017 spread::nor_commuters_2017_b2020 #>                   from              to    n #>     1: municip_nor0301 municip_nor1101   71 #>     2: municip_nor0301 municip_nor1103 1423 #>     3: municip_nor0301 municip_nor1106  332 #>     4: municip_nor0301 municip_nor1108  652 #>     5: municip_nor0301 municip_nor1111    5 #>    ---                                      #> 23894: municip_nor5444 municip_nor5439    3 #> 23895: municip_nor5444 municip_nor5440    1 #> 23896: municip_nor5444 municip_nor5441   33 #> 23897: municip_nor5444 municip_nor5442   12 #> 23898: municip_nor5444 municip_nor5443    8

title: Commuter Model Intro
text: simulate one measles outbreak using datasets spread::nor_seiiar_measles_oslo_2017_b2020 spread::nor_commuters_2017_b2020: Inspecting data Oslo: can merge information counties, create county level data: can produce daily epicurve county:  can produce weekly maps:

title: Authors and Citation
text: package proudly brought : Solveig Engebretsen. Author. Andreas Nygård Osnes. Author. Gunnar Rø. Author. Richard Aubrey White. Author, maintainer. . Copyright holder. See changelog contributors. 🙏

title: Authors and Citation
text: Engebretsen S, Osnes , Rø G, White RA (2023). spread: Infectious Disease Spread Models. https://docs.sykdomspulsen./spread, https://github.com/sykdomspulsen-org/spread.
code: @Manual{,   title = {spread: Infectious Disease Spread Models},   author = {Solveig Engebretsen and Andreas Nygård Osnes and Gunnar Rø and Richard Aubrey White},   year = {2023},   note = {https://docs.sykdomspulsen.no/spread, https://github.com/sykdomspulsen-org/spread}, }

title: Infectious Disease Spread Models
text: spread contains different infectious disease spread models. Currently implemented commuter model. model stochastic SEIIaR (susceptible, exposed, infectious, infectious asymptomatic, recovered) metapopulation model includes commuting. location local infection system, locations connected people commute day. model differentiates day night. day can infect/infected location work, night can infect/infected location live. commuters travel back forth day. start day, commuters sent work location, mix 12 hours. commuters sent respective home locations, mix 12 hours. model based upon published model. Read introduction vignette run help(package="spread").

title: Infectious Disease Spread Models
text: splverse set R packages developed help solve problems frequently occur performing infectious disease surveillance. want install dev versions (access packages haven’t released CRAN), run usethis::edit_r_profile() edit .Rprofile. write : Save file restart R. can now install splverse packages drat repository.
code: options(   repos = structure(c(     SPLVERSE  = "https://docs.sykdomspulsen.no/drat/",     CRAN      = "https://cran.rstudio.com"   )) ) install.packages("spread")

Float, infection parameter, 0.6 latent_period Float, 1.9 infectious_period Float, 3 asymptomatic_prob Float, Proportion/probability asymptomatic given infectious asymptomatic_relative_infectiousness Float, Relative infectiousness asymptomatic infectious N Int = 1 int, Number internal simulations (average taken). generally used parameter fitting.

title: commuter — commuter

title: commuter — commuter
text: seiiar Data frame containing `location_code`, `S`, `E`, ``, `Ia`, `R` entire population commuters Data frame comtaining ``, ``, `n` number people travel r0 Float, basic reproduction number beta Float, infection parameter, 0.6 latent_period Float, 1.9 infectious_period Float, 3 asymptomatic_prob Float, Proportion/probability asymptomatic given infectious asymptomatic_relative_infectiousness Float, Relative infectiousness asymptomatic infectious days_simulation Int, Number days simulate N Int = 1 int, Number internal simulations (average taken). generally used parameter fitting. simulations Int, Number simulations (returned). generally used generate stochastic results. verbose boolean seed seed aggregate_location want aggregate location_codes?

title: commuter — commuter
text: year middle year 5 year range (e.g. 2011 average data 2009-2013). location_code location code. age population age. vax vaccine. proportion Proportion people vaccinated. imputed FALSE real data. TRUE national average.

title: commuter — commuter
text: location local infection system, locations connected people commute day. model differentiates day night. day can infect/infected location work, night can infect/infected location live. commuters travel back forth day. start day, commuters sent work location, mix 12 hours. commuters sent respective home locations, mix 12 hours. model loosely based upon published model Engebretsen (2019) doi: 10.1371/journal.pcbi.1006879 . information, look vignette("commuter_model","spread")

title: commuter — commuter

title: spread 2020.3.19
text: typo variable name

title: spread 2020.3.18
text: Including asymptomatic incidence asymmetric_mobility_se1e2iiar

title: spread 2020.3.14
text: Initial commit asymmetric_mobility_se1e2iiar

title: spread 2020.3.5
text: Initial commit asymmetric_mobility

title: spread 2020.1.31
text: Included branching process functions GunnarOyvindIsaksson.Ro@fhi.branching_process fit_params_bp plot_quantiles_bp summarize_bp

title: spread 2020.1.30
text: Included option “aggregate_location” commuter function. automatically aggregate results locations, resulting smaller memory footprint. Useful simulations large number.

title: spread 2020.1.28
text: Included option “simulations” (number simulations repeated) commuter function via foreach loop, allowing simulations run parallel desired (backend must registered externally package).

title: spread 2020.1.27
text: Included option “verbose” commuter function. Exported functions: commuter convert_blank_seiiar_with_vax Exported datasets: norway_commuters_2017_b2020 norway_seiiar_noinfected_2017_b2020 norway_seiiar_oslo_2017_b2020 norway_seiiar_measles_noinfected_2017_b2020 norway_seiiar_measles_oslo_2017_b2020 single_entity_fake_commuters_2017.rda (new) single_entity_seiiar_2017.rda (new)

title: spread 2020.1.23
text: Upgraded 2020 borders. Exported functions: commuter convert_blank_seiiar_with_vax Exported datasets (now tagged "_b2020" show 2020 borders): norway_commuters_2017_b2020 norway_seiiar_noinfected_2017_b2020 norway_seiiar_oslo_2017_b2020 norway_seiiar_measles_noinfected_2017_b2020 norway_seiiar_measles_oslo_2017_b2020
